TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PrintQueueStringProperty extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents one, and only one, of three possible properties of a print queue: , , or .

remarks.format:
## Remarks An object of this class is primarily used as a parameter for one of the overloaded <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.InstallPrintQueue%2A> methods of a <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer>. This method makes it possible to install a print queue while initializing only one of its three major <xref:System.String> properties. Having three separate overloads of the method is not possible because they would have the same signature and no two overloads of a method can have the same signature. If you want to install a print queue and initialize two or more of its major string properties, there is another overload, <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.InstallPrintQueue%2A>, that substitutes three <xref:System.String> parameters for the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty> parameter. These parameters are used to set the major String properties in this order: <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.ShareName%2A>, <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.Comment%2A>, and <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.Location%2A>. Use an empty string for a parameter that corresponds to a property you do not want to initialize.
> [!CAUTION] > Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service. Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the value of the print queue property that is represented.
Docs.value: A with the value of the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, if the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty.Type%2A> is <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringPropertyType.Location>, the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty.Name%2A> might be "Department Supply Room"; but if the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty.Type%2A> is <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringPropertyType.Comment>, the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty.Name%2A> might be "Use only A4 size paper with this printer."

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that identifies which of the three possible properties of a print queue is being represented.
Docs.value: A that specifies the kind of print queue property that is being represented.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer.InstallPrintQueue%2A> method of a <xref:System.Printing.PrintServer> uses this information to ensure that the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueueStringProperty.Name%2A> value is assigned to the correct property of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> being installed.
